qas.question: What type of production techniques did Dennis Bovell develop?

What took a central roll for the emerging post-punk music?

context: The <a0_0>innovative<a0_0/> production techniques devised by <a1_0>post-punk<a1_0/> producers such as <a5_0><b10_0>Martin Hannett and Dennis Bovell<b10_0/><a5_0/> during this period would become an important element of the emerging music, with <a2_0><a9_0>studio experimentation<a9_0/><a2_0/> taking a central role. A variety of groups that predated punk, such as <a6_0><b11_0><b12_0>Cabaret Voltaire and Throbbing Gristle<b12_0/><b11_0/><a6_0/>, experimented with <a3_0>crude production techniques<a3_0/> and electronic instruments in tandem with performance art methods and influence from transgressive literature, ultimately helping to pioneer industrial music. <a4_0>Throbbing Gristle's<a4_0/> independent label <a7_0><a8_0><b13_0>Industrial Records<b13_0/><a8_0/><a7_0/> would become a hub for this scene and provide it with its namesake.
